events.name: Droidcon Vietnam 2019

venue.name: RMIT University Vietnam, Saigon South campus

events.description:
ğŸ”µ Droidcon is the largest global network of developer conferences which bring together the industry's foremost experts dedicated to advancing the Android platform.

ğŸ”µDroidcon is the place to meet the international Android community, learn from expert speakers and dive into the latest Android advances and explore cutting edge technologies, and it will be coming back to Vietnam again in 13th July, 2019.

ğŸ”µThe 2019 edition of droidcon in Vietnam will bring together android for everyone to celebrate the very best projects through the conference with more 16 professionals from inside or outside Vietnam .

events.name: Transferable Skills in Tech + IamRemarkable (Everyone is welcome)
events.description:
*IMPORTANT* Please bring your government issued ID to enter the venue.
Arrive at least 15 minutes before the event start. Doors closes once event starts.

***RSPV required, please sign up using this Link***
https://www.womenmeettech.org/event-info/wmt-1-transferable-skills-and-iamremarkable

For more info, please visit https://www.facebook.com/events/374509829931546/

[Summary of content]
Beginners! Join us to know about how our tech advocates pick up their career in tech from different backgrounds and you can find your answers too.
#IamRemarkable, a Google initiative to empower women

[Program Agenda]
5:00-5:15 Introduction
5:15-6:00 Guest speakers present their tips on Transferable Skills in Tech
6:00-6:20 Q&A
6:20-7:00 #IamRemarkable

[Guest speakers]
Mark Evans - Frontend Developer NFQ Asia, former National Service Manager Wall Street English Vietnam & Korea
Quynh Ruby - Software Engineer EGANY
Tham Le - Sr Software Engineer Chotot

Host - Lea Truc - Google Women Techmaker Ambassador, former college faculty in Boston, MA.

events.name: Web Tech basics + Diversity CrowdPitch
events.description:
*PLEASE BRING YOUR LAPTOP
*Since the event will be hosted at the US. Consulate HCMC, please bring your Government Issue ID to enter the venue. Without ID, access will be denied. Thank you for your understanding!
*Children under 15 are not permitted to enter the venue.

*RSVP here: http://bit.ly/2JxH3Tx

---------------------

'What I cannot create, I do not understand.' - Richard P. Feynman
Web technology is all around us and is a part of our modern life. How to understand it at the core? How to create something meaningful that you can share to the world?

Join us for our mini-bootcamp where you will learn about the most updated web technologies. For Beginners!!!

*For non-coding professionals to learn about web application basics, pitching for diversity and inclusion. No-coding experience required.

ğŸ”¥Code, get support, and win small prize in the very first Diversity Crowdpitch in Vietnam ğŸ”¥

EVERYONE IS WELCOME TO JOIN! ğŸ™‹â€â™‚ï¸ğŸ™‹â€â™€ï¸ğŸ™†â€â™€ï¸ğŸ™†â€â™‚ï¸

-----------------------
SPEAKERS
- Lea Truc - Google Women Techmaker Ambassador, lead Women Meet Tech.
- Tham Le - Sr Software Engineer Chotot
- Quynh Ruby - Software Engineer Egany, admin at Bi Kip Lam Web

SECTION 1 (1:30 - 4:45 PM)
- Web Tech basics Lecture
- Pitch deck preparation: how to deliver a great pitch
- Form teams and Hands-on coding (with support from Women Meet Tech team)

SECTION 2 (05:00 - 6:00 PM)
- Diversity CrowdPitch: Best team present project pitches
- 10' Break
- Result Announcement and Certificate
events.how_to_find_us: 8 Floor, Diamond Plaza, Le Duan st. Please remember to bring your ID / Passport to check in to the American Center

events.name: IDEATION to LAUNCH (Everyone is welcome to join!)
events.description:
Ever wonder what's it like to build a tech product from scratch? How engineers, product managers, marketers etc. join force to build and launch awesome products to the market?

Maybe you can use this knowledge build something of your own in the future.

On the afternoon of September 24th, Women Meet Tech (a STEM program funded by the U.S. Consulate HCMC, co-sponsored by Google WomenTechmakers) are hosting a small hands-on workshop for non-techies to learn about how's it like to build a tech product.

The program is about Diversity and Inclusion, everyone is welcome to join!

NO tech or coding experience required!
---------------------------------
*Introduction to the process of building a tech product from scratch
*Examples / Use cases
*Hands-on Exercise (to help attendees understand the process)
*Attendees presents their outcome

Hint!!! Guest trainers ( will be announced soon) ^_^ have intensive experience on building tech startups and products in Vietnam and global markets ;) STAY TUNED!

â°LIMITTED SEATS!!!
Sign up hereğŸ‘‰https://www.womenmeettech.org/event-info/wmt-3-ideation-to-launch

-------------------------------------
NO tech or coding experience required!

***PLEASE BRING YOUR LAPTOP
***For security reason, GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID is required to enter the venue
events.how_to_find_us: Diamond Plaza, 8th Floor, US Consulate General HCMC

events.name: Kotlin Everywhere by GDG Vietnam, Ho Chi Minh City Chapter
events.description:
Kotlin Everywhere - organized by Google Developers Group Vietnam (GDG Vietnam) in Ho Chi Minh City.

Kotlin Everywhere is a global series of community-led events where developers can learn the essentials and best practices of Kotlin in Android, Google Cloud Platform, and multiplatform development.

We are more than happy to host "Kotlin Everywhere" event with our honored guest speakers and sessions:

*DSL in Kotlin - first experience
TOAN TRAN, Android Lead @Inspectorio

*Introduction to Coroutines on Android and Structured Concurrency
TAI NGUYEN, Android Developer @Quoine

*Multi-project in Kotlin
KHUONG CHAU, Web Application Lead @Solderfield Group Singapore

*Crowdsource
RESHMA SANGHVI DILIP KUMAR @Google

*Kotlin Concurrency Pattern
HUYNH QUANG THAO, Google Developer Expert

More details are coming soon. Stay tuned!

DATE & TIME:
From 08:30AM to 12:30PM
Saturday, September 28th 2019

VENUE:
KMS Technology Vietnam, 2 Tan Vien, Ward 2, Tan Binh District, HCMC.

RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/kotlin-everywhere-by-gdg-vietnam-ho-chi-minh-city-registration-71824393695

#KotlinEverywhere #gdgvietnam

events.name: Communication + Code + Cocktail (Everyone is welcome)
events.description:
As part of the big annual DevFest 2019, join us on an elegant night of Communication + Code + Cocktail (optional)

We will be exploring some of the updated technologies and how to effectively communicate across teams in a tech company. We will then have some hands codelab to understand the tools and process.

What's more?! Enjoy the evening with some nice drinks. We will cover drinks for participants per first come first serve basic. So please be on time! Seats are limited!

****SIGN UP NOW to secure your spot!****
Link to sign up:

https://www.womenmeettech.org/event-info/wmt-5-code-cocktail-gentlemen-are-welcome-too

People under 18 are not allowed to the venue.
Please bring your laptop!

-------------------
AGENDA:
*Panel discussion: Communication across [tech] teams
*Design Codelab ( Dark theme using Figma) - No Coding experience required

----------------------
SPEAKERS:
Fia Nguyen - Senior Designer @ Christina's
Ruby Quynh - Product Owner @ Egany / Admin Bi Kip Lam Web
Tham Le - Senior Software Engineer @ Cho Tot
Lea Truc - Google WomenTechmaker Ambassador / Lead @Women Meet Tech

----------------------
Venue sponsor: Kafnu HCMC

events.name: WMT #6 Pitch Crafting in Tech
events.description:
ğŸ”´TOMORROW, 2PM AT THE AMERICAN CENTER - U.S. CONSULATE GENERAL HCMC, VIETNAM. In this workshop, we will help you with:

ğŸ¤©Pitch Deck preparation (for the competition / your own topic)

ğŸ¤©Exclusive Announcement of ASEAN Tech Pitching competition for Diversity & Inclusion with a chance to win big prizes from sponsors (Cash up to $400, flight tickets, Google home minis and more)

ğŸ†ğŸMore info about the pitching competition here https://www.womenmeettech.org/pitch

-------------------------------
Register here for tomorrow event:
âœï¸âœï¸âœï¸âœï¸ https://www.womenmeettech.org/â€¦/wmt-6-pitch-crafting-in-tech

We hope to see you tomorrow ğŸ’•
------------------------------
SPEAKER PROFILES

Edgar Camago - Co-Founder and Chief Product Officer at One On One English.

Edgar is a passionate music producer and educator graduated from University of California, Berkeley. As an ed-tech startup veteran, Edgar's mission is to disrupt the education landscape in Vietnam -- a goal he sometimes affectionately dubs as, "building a company to become the Grab of Education." Within one year, his company has grown from 4 to 50 employees with 7-figures investment. He's currently in the process of pitching his startup to the next level.

ğŸ†ğŸMore info about the pitching competition here https://www.womenmeettech.org/pitch

Lea Truc - Google Women Techmaker Ambassador, lead Women Meet Tech.

https://www.womenmeettech.org/leatruc

events.name: FINAL ROUND - ASEAN Tech Pitching Competition for Diversity & Inclusion
events.description:
*Please bring your government issued ID to enter the venue

**RSVP required!

***Children under 15 are not permitted to enter the venue.

PLEASE BE AT THE VENUE AT LEAST 15 MINUTES BEFORE THE EVENT. WE START THE EVENT ON-TIME. THANK YOU!

--------------------

With representatives from ASEAN countries (Thailand, Brunei, Malaysia, Myanmar, the Philippines, and Vietnam), there is a wide range of pitch submissions to help women, children, LGBT+, seniors and everyone from different walks of life by using Technology. There will also be sharing from tech experts so you can learn more about the Tech scene in specifically for Diversity and Inclusion in Vietnam & around SEA.

To attend the event, please register at

https://www.womenmeettech.org/event-info/final-round-asean-tech-pitching-competition-for-diversity-inclusion

--------------------

AGENDA:

8:45 - 9:15: Check in & Networking
9:15 - 9:30: Welcome speech - Diversity & Inclusion in Tech for Vietnam (Lea Truc, Google WomenTechmakers Ambassador. Program Lead - Women Meet Tech at U.S. Consulate General HCMC, Vietnam)
9:30 - 10:00: Revolutionize Accessibility in Prosthetics Technology (Duoc Pham - Co-founder Vulcan Augmetics, R&D associate / Font-end developer)
10:00 - 11:00: Pitching time - Finale
11:00-11:20: Public Voting
11:20 - 11:30: Lucky Draw from Public Voting
11:30 - 12:00: Winner Announcement + Closing Ceremony
--------------------------------------
ABOUT US: Women Meet Tech is the first STEM program for Diversity and Inclusion in Vietnam and around SEA region. The program is funded and endorsed by the U.S. Consulate General HCMC, supported by Google Women Techmakers.

ğŸ“£This competition is made possible by partnership with YSEALI & Wedu and have received one of the top prizes for Regional Pitching for Gender Quality (sponsored by Department of State and is funded through a grant from U.S. Embassy Bandar Seri Begawan).
--------------------------------------

FINALE Judges:

Mr. Brian Neely - American Center Programming Coordinator at U.S. Consulate Ho Chi Minh city, Vietnam

Mr. Michael Heise - Consular Officer at U.S. Consulate Ho Chi Minh city, Vietnam

Ms. Thuong Nguyen - Project Manager, UNICEF's UPSHIFT Incubation Program

Mr. Thang Huynh - Co-founder InnovLab Asia / Foudinng Fellow of The Academy of Engineering & Technology for the Developing World (AETDEW) / President of Google Business Group HCMC

Ms. Tham Le - Senior Fullstack Engineer / Executive Technical Coach for WomenTechmaker Vietnam. Expertise in PHP, C/C++, Golang, Nodejs, ReactJS, MySQL, Postgresql.

Ms. Lea Truc - Google Women Techmaker Ambassador, lead Women Meet Tech.

events.name: WMT #8  Web Performance for Everyone
events.description:
***No-coding experience required! PLEASE BRING YOUR LAPTOP.

*IMPORTANT* * Please bring your government issued ID to enter the venue **RSVP required!

RSVP Link: https://www.womenmeettech.org/event-info/wmt-8-web-performance-for-everyone-no-coding-experience-required

***Children under 15 are not permitted to enter the venue.

--------------------
This event will be very helpful whether you are working in marketing, thinking of setting up your own website, online business, work with dev team, or simply want to stay updated. We will cover some tips and tools on web performance, accessibility, progressive web apps, SEO and more.

Explore Google Chrome DevTools, Lighthouse and other trendy tools that developers and designers around the world are using to improve their web performance.

This event will conclude our Women Meet Tech program Phase 1. We will also share exclusive updates about Women Meet Tech program Phase 2 if you're interested in being the first to know.

Speaker bios:

Ruby Quynh - Product Owner @ Egany / Admin Bi Kip Lam Web

Lea Truc - Google Women Techmaker Ambassador / Program lead Women Meet Tech.

RSVP Link: https://www.womenmeettech.org/event-info/wmt-8-web-performance-for-everyone-no-coding-experience-required
--------------------

WOMEN MEET TECH - The first STEM program for Diverisity & Inclusion funded and endorsed by the U.S. Consulate General HCMC, supported by Google Women Techmakers & hosted by Cat Can Code. Everyone is welcome to join!

We cover strategies for making a greater impact through the value of framing your message and yourself as part of a larger public conversation, especially in the tech ecosystem. Participants leave this session with some good ideas for a newly crafted professional bio or a clearer vision of where they want to be in the tech industry.

organizers.name: George N.
organizers.bio: George is an experience Senior Manager across different industries including IT, FMCG, Logistic & Education. He's currently Country Manager of 2359 Media, visiting lecturer of RMIT University & an entrepreneur who is opened for investment invitation.

organizers.name: Ngan
organizers.bio: Hi, I am Ngan learning how to be entrepreneur and write about local tech news in Vietnam on Twenty.vn. I love traveling and learning entrepreneurship from everyone around me.

group_profile.intro: I'm community builder in Vietnam, love tech startup & geeks world.

organizers.name: Lea T.
organizers.bio: Program Lead [Women Meet Tech] by the US Consulate HCMC. Lea Truc has led community events and seminars with TEDx, Google Developer Group Vietnam and more about tech & women empowerment. Google DEVFEST VIETNAM 2018 and IWD 2019: Women Meet Code.
